page.content: Our Village Policeman has been in the Force for ten years and has been stationed at Broadwas for eight years. When he was a boy he wanted to be an engine driver but when he grew up he first joined the Royal Navy.When he left the navy he did odd jobs for two years before becoming a policeman. The area he covers stretches either side of the A44 from the boundary of Worcester City going West for a distance of eight miles to the river bridge at Knightwick.This area has a population of about 2700 people. When he is on duty he works seven days a week, usually for eight hours each day but this depends very much on the sort of things he is involved in.During the day he has to deal with road accidents,stolen vehicles, thefts,burglaries,poachers,gypsies and once he even helped to deliver a baby.
